definition[0]: a social system within a group of people or animals in which each member knows who has a higher or lower rank than themselves
example[0]: Nobody wants to be at the bottom of the pecking order.
definition[1]: the way that people or companies are ranked according to how important, successful etc they are
example[1]: The IMF ranking is used to measure the pecking order of the worldâ€™s leading economic powers.
example[2]: Bonuses make it hard to tell exactly where directors stand in the corporate pecking order.
